snippet: A proposal affecting physicians in public hospitals represents a push away from the traditional model of rewarding doctors for the volume of the services they order.
abstract: Plan being negotiated by New York City public hospitals and physicians would link doctor compensation to patient evaluations and other measures of their care; proposal represents broad national push away from the traditional model of rewarding doctors for the volume of services they order.
lead_paragraph: A proposal affecting physicians in public hospitals represents a push away from the traditional model of rewarding doctors for the volume of the services they order.
